This Autumn, Kimpton Hotels & Restaurants presents ‘Leaf Peeping’ packages in Boston, Aspen and Baltimore
The transition of summer to autumn in North America has become an annual phenomenon with many ‘leaf peepers’ travelling to the USA to witness the bright and intense change of colour that appears with the fall foliage. Kimpton Hotels & Restaurants, the award-winning collection of boutique hotels in the USA, is therefore inviting UK holidaymakers to experience this seasonal spectacle with a range of ‘Leaf Peeping’ packages in Boston, Aspen and Baltimore.
For guests planning a trip to the historical city of Boston, Nine Zero is offering a ‘Leaf Peepin’ package including a concierge-recommended Leaf Peeping guide taking guests on a tour of the must-see foliage hot spots. Holidaymakers looking for an Aspen adventure can enjoy mountain views from Sky Hotel’s idyllic location at the base of Aspen Mountain with a special 20% autumn saving or outdoor enthusiasts looking to explore Baltimore’s autumnal beauty on two wheels can book Hotel Monaco’s ‘Ride Like a Local’ offer.
Packages with Kimpton Hotels & Restaurants this autumn include:
‘Leaf Peepin’ Package at Nine Zero, Boston
Located in downtown Boston, just a few minutes’ walk from some of the area’s leaf peeping hotspots such as Boston’s Public Gardens and the famous Esplanade, the Nine Zero Hotel invites guests to explore the best of New England’s fall foliage with its ‘Leaf Peepin’ package. The package includes overnight accommodation, valet parking, a complimentary autumn-inspired amenity, and a Chef’s Freedom Trail Mix packaged to-go so that visitors can explore the city with a snack and the hotel’s concierge-recommended Leaf Peeping guide.
Seven nights accommodation in a Deluxe Queen Room at Nine Zero Hotel including the ‘Leaf Peepin’ package costs from £2,777 per couple.Return flights with British Airways from London Heathrow Airport to Logan International Airport cost from £537 per person.
‘Fall Savings’ Offer at Sky Hotel, Aspen
Named after the aspen tree, whose leaves turn into a bright golden colour during autumn, Aspen in Colorado is one of the top destination choices for a leaf peeping holiday. Sky Hotel’s location, nestled at the base of Aspen Mountain, promises guests magnificent views of nature’s bright colours while relaxing in the hotel’s heated pool and spa. The hotel is also offering seasonal savings with 20% off accommodation available until 30 November 2015.
Seven nights accommodation in a Deluxe Guestroom at Sky Hotel, Aspen, including the Fall Savings offer costs from £799 per couple. Return flights with Lufthansa from London Heathrow Airport to Aspen–Pitkin County Airport cost from £841 per person.
‘Ride Like A Local’ Amenity at Hotel Monaco, Baltimore
Hotel Monaco, located in the heart of Baltimore, is inviting guests to experience the city’s seasonal beauty on two wheels. The hotel’s ‘Ride like a Local’ amenity provides visitors with biking routes and advice on the best spots for Baltimore leaf peeping rides. Guests looking to explore Baltimore’s best can ride north to the Maryland Zoo or to Locust Point and visit Fort McHenry National Museum and Historic Shrine, some of the city’s well-known historical monuments.
Seven nights accommodation in a King Deluxe Room at Hotel Monaco, Baltimore, including the ‘Ride Like a Local Amenity’ costs from £1,923 per couple. Return flights with Finnair from London Heathrow Airport to Baltimore International Airport cost from £731 per person.
